text: View along the beach Signboard at the entrance Leucadia State Beach, also known as Beacon's Beach, is a protected beach of California, United States, in Encinitas. It is operated as Beacon’s Beach by the city under a 20-year agreement with California Department of Parks and Recreation. It's a popular spot for swimming, surfing, fishing, and other beach activities. The site was established in 1949. ==See also== *List of California state parks ==References== == External links == *Leucadia State Beach Category:1949 establishments in California Category:Beaches of Southern California Category:California State Beaches Category:Beaches of San Diego County, California Category:Parks in San Diego County, California Category:Protected areas established in 1949
title: Leucadia State Beach
